member.name: T:SSDTExtensions.SSDTExtensionsPackage
member.summary: This is the class that implements the package exposed by this assembly.

remarks.para: The minimum requirement for a class to be considered a valid package for Visual Studio is to implement the IVsPackage interface and register itself with the shell. This package uses the helper classes defined inside the Managed Package Framework (MPF) to do it: it derives from the Package class that provides the implementation of the IVsPackage interface and uses the registration attributes defined in the framework to register itself and its components with the shell. These attributes tell the pkgdef creation utility what data to put into .pkgdef file.
To get loaded into VS, the package must be referred by <Asset Type="Microsoft.VisualStudio.VsPackage" ...> in .vsixmanifest file.

member.name: F:SSDTExtensions.SSDTExtensionsPackage.PackageGuidString
member.summary: SSDTExtensionsPackage GUID string.

member.name: M:SSDTExtensions.SSDTExtensionsPackage.InitializeAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.IProgress{Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.ServiceProgressData})
member.summary: Initialization of the package; this method is called right after the package is sited, so this is the place where you can put all the initialization code that rely on services provided by VisualStudio.
member.param: A cancellation token to monitor for initialization cancellation, which can occur when VS is shutting down.
member.returns: A task representing the async work of package initialization, or an already completed task if there is none. Do not return null from this method.
